snippet: Ben S. Bernanke said the recent rise in oil prices had not affected the Fed’s view that the economy would expand at from 2.2 to 2.7 percent this year.
abstract: Federal Reserve chairman Ben S Bernanke says the recent rise in oil prices has not affected the Fed’s view that the economy will expand at from 2.2 to 2.7 percent in 2012; pace is about the same as second-half 2011.
lead_paragraph: Ben S. Bernanke said the recent rise in oil prices had not affected the Fed’s view that the economy would expand at from 2.2 to 2.7 percent this year.

headline.seo: Bernanke Sees Modest Growth for Economy
headline.main: Federal Reserve Chairman Sees Modest Growth
headline.print_headline: Bernanke Sees Modest Growth for U.S. in 2012
